content.question: Which of the following is a difference between the parliamentary systems of China and the United Kingdom?

choices.label: The House of Commons has no checks on the executive, but the National People's Congress has several checks on the executive.
The House of Commons has almost 3,000 members, and the National People's Congress has only 650 members.
The House of Commons features Question Time and gives members the chance to question the prime minister, which does not occur in the National People's Congress.
The House of Commons rarely questions the authority of cabinet members, but votes of no confidence are regularly called in the National People's Congress.

content.answer: The House of Commons features Question Time and gives members the chance to question the prime minister, which does not occur in the National People's Congress.
